result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Raymond Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court imposed the applicable fees, assessments, Court costs and surcharges including DNA assessment.  DOC to collect any monetary amounts at the rate of 25% of any amounts provided in Secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while  defendant is in their control.  Any remaining unpaid amounts when released from confinement are to be paid  as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amounts unpaid when sentence is completed, are reduced to a judgment against defendant and collection can then proceed under Sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
-You may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

Per Remittitur dated December 11, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP000288 CRNM, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on October 30, 2018, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is affirmed pursuant to Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney George M. Tauscheck is relieved of any further representation of Kenneth Raymond Hall in this matter.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kenneth Raymond Hall in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Kenneth Raymond Hall in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Presentence report reviewed.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 32 YEARS, with credit for 272 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 25 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 7 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS.
THE COURT DID NOT ORDER THE DV SURCHARGE.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, court costs, and surcharges, including a DNA assessment.  You may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;

Defendant Kenneth Raymond Hall in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel needs more time to confer with his client regarding the PSI. Per Judge McAdams this case can be adjourned off the record.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Kenneth Raymond Hall not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel informs the court that the defendant is requesting a PSI (parties did not address with/without recommendations). Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

SAME APPEARANCES. 
Trial resumed at 1:31 pm. Defense rests (on the record). Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:23 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Mike Johnson and Mark Pawalk who were duly sworn for that purpose.  At the hour of 3:39 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Kenneth Raymond Hall in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Kenneth Raymond Hall in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Trial resumed at 9:00 am. Sworn for the state: Marquise Green, MPD Detective Rodney Gonzales and MPD Officer Joan Mueller. Exbibits 7, 2-3. State rests. Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court. Sidebar held. Sworn for the defense: Faye R., and Raymond Hall.  Defense rests (off the record) (Court instructs the jury. Jurors released for lunch at 11:49 am. 

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

SAME APPEARANCES.
Trial resumed at 1:48 pm. Court instructed jury.  Jurors sworn. Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Anticola C., MPD Officer Joan Mueller and M.R. DOB 3.19.11 Sidebar held.  Exhibits  1-5 received. Jurors released for the day at 4:00 pm to return tommorrow at 8:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Raymond Hall in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Kenneth Raymond Hall in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:30 am.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court in recess for lunch at 12 pm.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Kenneth Raymond Hall in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Kenneth Raymond Hall in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State requests an adjournment to meet with a potential witness. Court grants state's request.   Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 7.  Jury trial scheduled for 10-21-2015 at 09:30 am.
DEFENDANT'S WITNESS LIST. FILED BY STEPHEN SARGENT ATTORNEY FOR DEFENDANT. kl

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Kenneth Raymond Hall not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case still in trial posture.
Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (10 pages) commencing 05/26/2015 received and filed.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Kenneth Raymond Hall not in court, in custody.  Erin Karshen for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has only received partial discovery. Defense requested final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Parties to file motions by 06/26/2015. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Parties advised as of 8/01/2015 this case will be assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 07 in Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Raymond Hall in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Kenneth Raymond Hall in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Department Officer Joan Mueller.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: MR
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kenneth Raymond Hall in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Kenneth Raymond Hall in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant. 
Court advised Defendant he  may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
